snippet: The ruling by a military court came after a civilian court had concluded that the military had wrongly forced detained protesters to undergo forced “virginity tests.”
abstract: Egyptian military court acquits Ahmed Adel el-Mogy, doctor accused of performing 'virginity tests' on women protesters detained by soldiers in 2011.
lead_paragraph: The ruling by a military court came after a civilian court had concluded that the military had wrongly forced detained protesters to undergo forced “virginity tests.”

headline.seo: Egyptian Court Acquits Doctor Over ‘Virginity Tests’
headline.main: Egyptian Military Court Acquits Doctor Accused of Performing ‘Virginity Tests’
headline.print_headline: Egyptian Military Court Acquits Doctor Accused of Performing ‘Virginity Tests’
